messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Shigetsugu complicated Soshu mei
messages.msgSnippet: Ron, Thanks. That was very interesting. -Especially the poem. I gave it a try when you first posted it, and didn t have much success with it. I looked up
messages.messageBody:
Ron,

Thanks. That was very interesting.
-Especially the poem. I gave it a try when you
first posted it, and didn't have much success with it.
I looked up Masura in W.H. Edmunds' Subjects of Chin.
& Japanese Art, but did not find reference. Any idea
where better to look?

Curran



--- Ron Polansky <rpolansky@...> wrote:
> List:
>
> I recently posted a jpg of a wonderful nakago on a
> Shigetsugu I had
> the opportunity to study for awhile before I placed

> Very difficult mei; impossible for me. A martial
> artist in Tokyo,
> Lisa T., through her iai instructor provided a
> translation:
> http://www.nihontophile.com/KanjiTrans.jpg
>
> I thought the list might enjoy the translation.
>
> Regards,
> Ron P.
> ps big jpg 330k....

messages.subject: Shigetsugu complicated Soshu mei
messages.msgSnippet: List: I recently posted a jpg of a wonderful nakago on a Shigetsugu I had the opportunity to study for awhile before I placed it in a new home. Very difficult
messages.messageBody:
List:

I recently posted a jpg of a wonderful nakago on a Shigetsugu I had
the opportunity to study for awhile before I placed it in a new home.
Very difficult mei; impossible for me. A martial artist in Tokyo,
Lisa T., through her iai instructor provided a translation:
http://www.nihontophile.com/KanjiTrans.jpg

I thought the list might enjoy the translation.

Regards,
Ron P.
ps big jpg 330k....
